attributes.text:
The part loader knows about all generated packages and parts.

It contains functionality to load parts and to retrieve part instances.
Fired if a parts was loaded. The data of the event instance point to the loaded part instance.
Fired if a part could not be loaded. The event’s {@link qx.event.type.Data#getData} method returns the name of the failed part.

Returns a singleton instance of this class. On the first call the class is instantiated by calling the constructor with no arguments. All following calls will return this instance.

This method has been added by setting the “type” key in the class definition ({@link qx.Class#define}) to “singleton”.
List of parts names to load as defined in the config file at compile time.
Function to execute on completion. The function has one parameter which is an array of ready states of the parts specified in the partNames argument.
Context to execute the given function in
Loads one or more parts asynchronously. The callback is called after all parts and their dependencies are fully loaded. If the parts are already loaded the callback is called immediately.
Name of the part as defined in the config file at compile time.
Get the part instance of the part with the given name.
List of parts names to load as defined in the config file at compile time. The method also accepts a single string as parameter to only load one part.
Context to execute the given function in
Loads one or more parts asynchronously. The callback is called after all parts and their dependencies are fully loaded. If the parts are already loaded the callback is called immediately.
